MmsSmsInfosProxy * mpMmsSmsInfosProxy

Detailed Description

This class provides the ability to query the MMS and SMS databases at the same time, mixing messages from both in a single thread.

A virtual column, MmsSmsInfos::TYPE_DISCRIMINATOR_COLUMN, may be requested in the projection for a query. Its value is either "mms" or "sms", depending on whether the message represented by the row is a MMS message or a SMS message, respectively.

This class also provides the ability to find out what addresses participated in a particular thread. It doesn't support updates for either of these.

This class provides a way to allocate and retrieve thread IDs. This is done atomically through a query. There is no add URI for this.

Finally, this class provides a way to remove or set all messages in a thread.

The following example demonstrates how to use this MmsSmsInfos class.

 showAndEditMmsSmsInfos() {
     Context* context = new Context(this);
     MmsSmsInfos* mmsSmsInfos = new MmsSmsInfos(*context);
     StringArray selection(4);
     selection.replaceAt(MmsSmsInfos::PENDINGMESSAGES_ID(), 0);
     selection.replaceAt(MmsSmsInfos::PENDINGMESSAGES_MSG_ID(), 1);
     selection.replaceAt(MmsSmsInfos::PENDINGMESSAGES_PROTO_TYPE(), 2);
     selection.replaceAt(MmsSmsInfos::PENDINGMESSAGES_ERROR_TYPE(), 3);

     // Show MmsSms Pending Message Infoss
     Cursor* cr = mmsSmsInfos->getN(MmsSmsInfos::PENDINGMESSAGES_URI(),
                      &selection, NULL, NULL, &MmsSmsInfos::PENDINGMESSAGES_ID());

     if (cr != NULL && cr->getCount() > 0) {
         cr->moveToFirst();
         do {
             int64_t id = cr->getLong(0);
             int64_t msgId = cr->getLong(1);
             int32_t protocolType = cr->getInt(2);
             int32_t errorType = cr->getInt(3);

             // ...
         } while (cr->moveToNext());
     }
     // Close the cursor
     cr->close();

     // Edit a MmsSms Pending Message Infos
     ContentValues* cv = new ContentValues();
     cv->addValue(MmsSmsInfos::PENDINGMESSAGES_ERROR_TYPE(),
                  MmsSmsInfos::ERR_TYPE_MMS_PROTO_PERMANENT);

     Uri uri1 = ContentUris::withAppendedId(MmsSmsInfos::PENDINGMESSAGES_URI(), updateId);
     mmsSmsInfos->set(uri1, *cv, NULL, NULL);

     delete context;
     delete mmsSmsInfos;
     delete cv;
 }

See the sample given above. There are four operations about MmsSmsInfos: edit and show.

storage::Cursor* gaia::content::MmsSmsInfos::getN ( const net::Uri &  uri,
const base::StringArray *  selection,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs,
const base::String *  sort 
)

Query the given table, returning a Cursor over the result set.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
selectionA list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns, which is discouraged to prevent reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
sortHow to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Returns:
A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry. Note that Cursors are not synchronized, see the documentation for more details.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

int32_t gaia::content::MmsSmsInfos::remove ( const net::Uri &  uri,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs 
)

Delete rows in the database which uri specified.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
Returns:
The number of rows affected if a whereClause is passed in, 0 otherwise. To remove all rows and get a count pass "1" as the whereClause.
